page.title: 01Norton Area.
page.content: The area is mainly{arable}and {pasture}land, with some{woodland. } The Mad Brook flows from the north west, joining the River Worfe in the middle of its course near the eastern boundary of the region. The land is about 250 feet above sea level at Norton, rising to 275 feet NE of Brockton Bridge,with a hill of over 325 feet at Havenhills. It falls more steeply to the River Worfe valley, which is below 175 feet around Higford.{ { Norton}and most of{Sutton Maddock} is included in the region, with small settlements at{Harrington}and{Higford. It reaches to the edge of Ryton and Beckbury, and includes the busy road junction of the A442, B4379 and B4176 (Rabbit Run) at Sutton Maddock. {Farming}is the main industry.
